messageBody:
How can I check this? Because i'm a little confused right now. I need to use URLClassLoader to load classes from projects I want my plugin to monitor (or is there by any chance much better way i didn't think of?) - the first URL in the constructor points at monitored project output directory. But without the second URL classes were loaded without @Test annotations. While debugging i discovered exception

com.sun.jdi.ClassNotLoadedException: Type has not been loaded occurred while retrieving component type of array.

while trying to preview method's annotations. So i added another URL which points at JUnit jar from Eclipse. Annotations appeared but i'm not 100% sure why it worked.

However, I just run some tests and it seems, that:

clazzLoader.loadClass("org.junit.Test").equals(Test.class)

evaluates to false... I don't know what to do - is there any way i could decorate JUnitCore with my URLClassLoader? Because as far as i know (and i've spent some time googling for it) using URLClassLoader is the only sensible way to dynamically load classes from class files...

Thanks for your reply Gilles and once again, i'd be very grateful for any more help.

Best regards,
Michal Olejnik

PS. Forgive me if my english is bad, but i've been fighting with this for whole day and i'm just too tired to pay much attention to grammar and spelling. However i hope what i wrote is not very hard to understand

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Gilles Scokart <gscokart@...> wrote:
>
> Is the @Test referenced by the unit test and the @Test used by the runner
> coming from the same classloader ? If not, they are different annotations.
>
>
> Gilles Scokart
>
>
> 2009/5/16 blekit@... <blekit@...>
>
> >
> >
> > Hello,
> >
> > i'm currently writing a plugin which is supposed to launch JUnit4 Tests
> > after each save. So far i'm only loading every class that is changed using
> > IResourceChangedListener and URLClassLoader:
> >
> > URLClassLoader classLoader = new URLClassLoader(new URL[]
> > {outputDirectory.toURL(), new
> > URL("file:/D:/eclipse/plugins/org.junit4_4.3.1/junit.jar") });
> >
> > Class<?> clazz = classLoader.loadClass(fileName);
> >
> > At this point everything looks great - when i modify JUnit4 test class it
> > gets loaded with annotations on proper methods (thanks to second URL -
> > without it no annotation was loaded, and to be honest i don't know why).
> > However, things start to go wrong when i pass the loaded class to
> > JUnitCore.run method - the result i always get says that there was "No
> > runnable method" exception even though there are clearly some method
> > annotaded with @Test...
> >
> > I have little experience in writing plugins for Eclipse, so i'm kind of
> > lost now... I may suspect, that the problem is with not sufficient classpath
> > (cause it seems that it was a reason why i had to add another URL to class
> > loader) of my plugin. So i'm asking if anyone ever tried to dynamically load
> > test classes from Eclipse plugin and run them using JUnitCore - if so, I'd
> > be very grateful for helping me out with this problem.
> >
> > Thanks in advance.
> > Best regards,
> > Michal Olejnik
> >
> >
> >
